ground_truth_answer: Authentication and unauthorized access prevention have different but complementary methods. Authentication in enterprise systems requires verifying user identity through mechanisms like basic authentication (username/password) or form-based authentication, as prerequisites for system access. On the prevention side, unauthorized access is countered through multiple security measures including installing security patches, maintaining firewalls, using strong passwords, and implementing proper access controls. Both approaches rely on authorization - authentication determines user identity while access prevention ensures only authorized users can access specific resources based on their security roles and identities.
